algorithm_technique: Difference array / sweep line with hash map
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest position on a street with the most street lamps illuminating it.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a difference array (implemented with a hash map) to track changes in brightness, then finds the smallest position with maximum brightness.
time_complexity: O(N log N) where N is the number of lights, due to sorting the hash map keys
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding the point with maximum overlap of intervals.
A difference array (or sweep line) approach efficiently calculates the brightness at each relevant point.
Sorting the start and end points of the illuminated intervals allows for a single pass to find the maximum.
